intro: Gethyllis britteniana subsp. bruynsii, commonly known as the Cape gold dot, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom repeatedly throughout the growing season.
